intro: Pityrodia augustensis, commonly known as the Cape York mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers. Its berries are red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Pityrodia augustensis plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for native birds and insects.
